Calls for Labor Among the Negro 
                  Race in the South 


          Our Duty to the Colored People 


     Those who have a religious experience that opens their hearts to Jesus, will not cherish pride, but will feel that they are under obligation to God to be missionaries as was Jesus. They will seek to save that which is lost. They will not, in Pharisaical pride and haughtiness, withdraw themselves from any class of humanity, but will feel with the apostle Paul, "I am debtor both to the Greeks, and to the barbarians; both to the wise, and to the unwise." . . .
